result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric Lee Hale appeared by video, in custody from Racine Youthful Correctional.  Prosecuting attorney Meranda Hillmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Prompt dispo request by def.  No atty yet.  Bond cont.
Status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Eric Lee Hale not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Caleb Saunders in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant transported to Dodge.  Bond cont.
Status hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Assistant District Attorney Natalie Mulvey appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Eric Lee Hale Jr in court via zoom from BCJ. Attorney Kohl appears on behalf of the Public Defender's office. SPD is still looking for an Attorney. Court reserves bond argument for next hearing. Court finds good cause to exceed time limits. Present bond continued.

Prosecuting attorney Ryan M Spaude in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Lee Hale in court, in custody.State Public Defender's Office has not appointed attorney for defendant.  Present bond continued
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Aaron Linssen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Lee Hale Jr in court, in custody at the Brown County Jail. Court finds good cause to exceed time limits due to defendant not having an attorney yet from SPD.
Present bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant refused to sign cash bond sheet.

Defendant to have no contact with A.C.E. or their residence or place of employment.
Defendant to possess no weapons. 
Bond arguments reserved.

Prosecuting attorney Natalie M. Mulvey in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Lee Hale Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney James M. Schoenecker in court for Eric Lee Hale Jr.  All parties appear via zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
